net.myorb.math

Class TaylorPolynomials<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.myorb.math.SignManager
      • net.myorb.math.ComputationConfiguration<T>
        • net.myorb.math.Arithmetic<T>
          • net.myorb.math.ListOperations<T>
            • net.myorb.math.Tolerances<T>
              • net.myorb.math.GeneratingFunctions<T>
                • net.myorb.math.MathSupport<T>
                  • net.myorb.math.Polynomial<T>
                    • net.myorb.math.TaylorPolynomials<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type on which operations are to be executed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PowerLibrary<T>, SignManagementOperations

    public class TaylorPolynomials<T>
extends Polynomial<T>
implements PowerLibrary<T>
    coding of Taylor polynomials for commonly used functions
    Author:
    Michael Druckman

      • getLnSeries

      • logUsingBase

        public T logUsingBase(Arithmetic.Value<T> x,
                      Arithmetic.Value<T> threshold,
                      Arithmetic.Value<T> base,
                      Arithmetic.Value<T> baseConversion)
        natural logarithm calculation for x LT 1. domain reduced further to x GT THRESHOLD to improve convergence speed
        Parameters:
        x - the value to use as parameter of computation (x LT 1) in arithmetic object wrapper
        threshold - the low bound of the domain reduction to use in preparation for power series evaluation
        base - the base value of the logarithm to be applied, characteristic counted in domain reduction, mantissa converted
        baseConversion - the conversion divisor from natural log (ln(base)) according to log[base b](x) = log[base k](x) / log[base k](b) using k=e
        Returns:
        log with specified base

      • lnLessThan1

        public T lnLessThan1(Arithmetic.Value<T> x)

      • ln

        public T ln(T value)
        Description copied from interface: PowerLibrary
        compute natural log
        Specified by:
        ln in interface PowerLibrary<T>
        Parameters:
        value - parameter for computation
        Returns:
        computed result

      • log

        public T log(T value,
             T base)
        use identity log[base b](x) = log[base k](x) / log[base k](b). the Taylor series computes natural logarithm, so this implies k=e
        Parameters:
        value - the value for which to compute the logarithm
        base - the base of the logarithm to be computed
        Returns:
        computed logarithm with specified base

        Parameters:

        Returns:
